section.title: Designate Installation Overview
section.p: The Designate service supports several different backends for domain name service. The choice of backend must be included in the deployment model before the install is completed. By default, the example models will deploy and configure PowerDNS onto the control plane nodes.
The backends that are available within the Designate service are separated into three categories, self-contained, external, and 3rd Party.

row.entry: All components necessary will be installed and configured as part of the HOS install.
POCs and customers who wish to keep cloud and traditional DNS separated.
The authoritative DNS server itself is external to HOS, management and configuration is out of scope for HLM but remains the responsibility of the customer.
Customers who wish to integrate with their existing DNS infrastructure.
The authoritative DNS server itself is external to HOS, and is managed by a 3rd Party service provider.
